metadata.dc:author: Bugarín-Diz, C
Bugarín-González, R
metadata.dc:description: Gender violence is a health problem that occasionally gives rise to ethical dilemmas for the family doctor. One of the most important conflict is probably when a patient admits to being abused by her partner, but appeals to keep the information confidential, and refuses to present an injury report. There also other problematic situations. This essay attempts to reflect on these issues and help professionals in making decisions.
metadata.dc:subject: Battered women
Domestic violence
Cuestiones éticas
Bioethical issues
Spouse abuse
Violencia doméstica
Mujer maltratada
Violencia de pareja
metadata.dc:title: Aspectos éticos en la atención sanitaria de la violencia de género.
[Ethical issues in health care of gender violence].
